Class Observation

java.lang.Object
DataHolders.DataPoint
DataHolders.Observation
public class Observation extends DataPoint
This class extends DataPoints to also contain the date and times in which they were recorded or created
Version:
1.0.0

  • Constructor Details

    • Observation

      public Observation(String u, double d, Date da, Time t)
      Creates a new Observation with the given units, measure, date, and time
      Parameters:
      u - The units of the Observation
      d - The measure of the Observation
      da - The date the Observation was recorded
      t - The time the Observation was recorded

  • Method Details

    • getDateTaken

      public Date getDateTaken()
      Returns dateTaken
      Returns:
      Returns the date that the Observation was recorded

    • getTimeTaken

      public Time getTimeTaken()
      Returns timeTaken
      Returns:
      Returns the time that the Observation was recorded

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Observation o)
      Compares recorded times and dates of two Observations
      Parameters:
      o - The Observation being compared to this
      Returns:
      Returns an int representing whether o was recorded before, at the same time, or after this

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns the Observation as a String
      Overrides:
      toString in class DataPoint
      Returns:
      Returns a String in the form of "measure unit on: dateTaken at timeTaken"
